meanings.definition: The ability of a system to store an electric charge.
meanings.sent1: The capacitance of the battery allowed it to hold a lot of power.
meanings.sent2: The capacitance of the capacitor was crucial for storing energy in the circuit.
meanings.sent3: The robot's capacitance was so high that it could power itself for hours on end.
meanings.sent4: Her mind had a capacitance for knowledge that seemed limitless.
meanings.sent5: The capacitance of the cloud was evident as it crackled with lightning.

meanings.definition: The property of a capacitor that determines the amount of charge it can store per unit voltage.
meanings.sent1: The capacitance of the capacitor was measured in farads.
meanings.sent2: Increasing the capacitance of the capacitor allowed it to store more charge.
meanings.sent3: The capacitance of the capacitor was so high, it could hold a charge for days.
meanings.sent4: His creativity had a capacitance that seemed to grow with each new idea.
meanings.sent5: The capacitance of the dam was tested as it held back the water with ease.
